content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Factory Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (neighbors include a burner inserter from (2.5, 16.5))
– Assembling‐Machine‐1 at (1.5, 19.5)

### Extraction System Node at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)

### Extraction Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Belt Depot Wooden Chest at (3.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) (with pickup position (3.5, 15.5) and drop position (3.5, 13.5))

### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)

### Smelting Furnaces
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (producing iron plates) at (–3.0, 19.0)
– Stone Furnace (producing copper plates) at (–4.0, 21.0)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When connecting transport belts, the target entity was repeatedly a Prototype.SteamEngine; use an inserter (or other valid input) as the target instead.
• For placement errors due to distance (e.g. the wooden chest at (3.5,15.5)), move closer so that the distance is within the allowed range.
• Ensure that all required variables (such as the target_chest) are defined before use to avoid NameError issues.
• Verify that inventory contains the needed items (for example, wooden chests) before attempting placement.
